info.name: Secret Street
info.attribution:
Library image taken from "The Black Mask" No. 1, Pulp Magazine published April 1922 and which is in the Public Domain available at https://archive.org/details/bm_1920_08/page/n26/mode/1up?view=theater.

Game layout, scripting, and card design initially done by QwertyMartin and available in the Public Domain. Revisions and formatting for VTT by dexdouglas. Released to the Public Domain under CC0.
info.description: In Secret Streets, two spies are locked in pursuit of one another. Can you recruit the right agents to your team fast enough to catch your nemesis?
info.similarAwards:
2025 Spiel des Jahres Recommended
2024 Golden Geek Best 2-Player Board Game Nominee
info.helpText:
This game can be played with 2, 3, or 4 players. If playing with more than 2 players, you will play in 2 teams (red vs blue). If you are the playing as the red player/team, you will sit on the left side of the table. If you are playing as the blue player/team, you will sit on the right side.

Select if you want to play the Basic or Advanced game. The Advanced game introduces special action cards that you will draw if you land on the black arrows in the corner of the game board. If you are playing the Basic game, treat the arrow spaces as normal spaces.

When all players are seated and a game is selected, each player will be dealt 4 cards from the main draw deck (the one with a spy wearing a hat). The game will randomly select the starting player (their name will be highlighted). 

On your turn, you will play one card to the face down holder and one to the face up holder. You cannot play two cards with the same name to both spaces. After playing the cards, you will hit the "Refill Hand" button to draw back up to 4 cards.
  Prior to playing any cards, you can choose to discard a card to your discard pile face down and draw a new card. You can do this multiple times in the same turn but you can only do this a max of 4 times in a game (max of 2 times per player if playing with a teammate). 

Your opponent will "recruit"(select) one card and place it in one of their 8 holders. There is a holder for each card type and you should only keep one card type in each holder. The active player will then recruit the remaining card. Then both players will simultaneously move their pawns in a clockwise direction equal to the number of spaces their recruited card indicates. If it is your first card of that type, look at the first number, if it's the second, look at the second number, and if it is your third card, or more, look at the third number. Negative numbers mean you move your pawn backwards that many spaces.

ADVANCED RULE: If you land on a space with a black arrow, immediately draw and resolve a card from the face up "back alley" row of 3 cards. Refill the card display immediately. If you land on another black arrow, draw and resolve another card. If both players land on a black arrow at the same time, the active player resolves their actions first, then the opponent. 

After all the cards are resolved, check for a win condition:
  • If a player reaches the same space, or overtakes their opponent, they win. 
  • If a player collects 3 codebreaker cards, they win
  • If a player collects 3 daredevil cards, their opponent wins
  • If the deck runs out of cards and your opponent has less than 2 cards in hand, the player who is closest to the other player wins.

In the event of a tie (meaning both players win, or lose, simultaneously, or both players are equidistant from each other at game end), the ACTIVE player breaks the tie and wins.

If there is no winner, press the End Turn button to move the highlighting to the next player in turn order.

thenRoutine: var red1 = ${PROPERTY turn OF seat1} == true
var red3 = ${PROPERTY turn OF seat3} == true

fields.text: You're about to recall all cards and reset the game. Are you sure?

type-572fb4f1-4e06-4f44-965a-9bf45b02ec3.name: Wheelman
type-572fb4f1-4e06-4f44-965a-9bf45b02ec3.effect: Ending on a home space gives +3

type-08ee6257-cf35-44a3-aa3a-bedae383b85.name: Alarms
type-08ee6257-cf35-44a3-aa3a-bedae383b85.effect: Opponent ending on your home = win

type-87720df4-3ca0-495c-8d6f-6bfbf156107.name: Camouflage
type-87720df4-3ca0-495c-8d6f-6bfbf156107.effect: Recruit top card of draw pile

type-6be10bc8-5eb5-4939-96d3-35e0865f5da.name: Brainwashing
type-6be10bc8-5eb5-4939-96d3-35e0865f5da.effect: Put 1 opponent agent in play into your hand

type-f38dcf60-22ca-4f48-ac84-a06d2fccacc.name: Trouble Trouble
type-f38dcf60-22ca-4f48-ac84-a06d2fccacc.effect: Reveal 2 matching agents, recruit one, keep the other

type-a667f3d9-bd47-4f6e-b6dc-b965035d854.name: New Blood
type-a667f3d9-bd47-4f6e-b6dc-b965035d854.effect: Recruit 1 agent from hand you don't already have

type-ca624c94-56fb-4be5-bbc1-7a237ffd71e.name: Discreet Trip
type-ca624c94-56fb-4be5-bbc1-7a237ffd71e.effect: Put 1 of your agents in your hand. You may recruit it.
